intro: Pharbitis medians, commonly known as morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its rapid growth and distinctive spiral-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including blue, purple, and white. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions but has been naturalized in many parts of the world. Pharbitis medians is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
